notes: This is an important herb for treating both recent and long term Blood Stasis because it can eliminate extravasated Blood through the bowels and eliminate Heat from Stasis.
This is a good herb for treating Blood Stasis due to traumatic injury.
This herb powdered and mixed with sesame oil is used to treat burns.
This herb is secreted by mother’s milk and is therefore contraindicated for nursing mothers.
It may cause Blood Stasis in the pelvis and is therefore not suitable during menstruation or pregnancy.
This herb occurs in most purgative formulas and many Blood Stasis formulas.
Cooked with grain-based liquor, it can be used for dysentery.
It is the most commonly used fast-acting purgative in the Chinese pharmacopia.
People with irritable bowels may experience diarrhea and cramping if given any attacking purgative.
Raw it can rescue the dying.
It inhibits the growth of cancer cells.
Used alone, it treats upper gastrointestinal tract bleeding.
It stops bleeding without causing Stagnation.
It can be used alone or in combination for Blood Stasis.
For brain bleeding with constipation, use 9g. in 15-20 ml hot water several times/ day using a stomach tube, or enema 1 time/day using 9g. in 200 ml water.
For tuberculosis patients with bronchiectasis, use 1.5g. Da Huang powder 1-2 times/ day.
Tao Huang San (Da Huang + Shi Hui {Calcium Oxide} + #{MingFan} Ming Fan (Alumen) and water may promote blood clot formation.
For hepatitis with jaundice, fresh Da Huang may lower transaminase level and relieve jaundice.
Do not use high dose for an extended period.
It is said to benefit the Gallbladder and to eliminate Food Stagnation.
It strongly mobilizes and directly reaches the Lower Jiao.
It enters the Jue Yin to clear Blood Heat and eliminate Blood Stasis.
It can be used to expel Phlegm-Heat through the Intestines.

Both Da Huang and Fr. Crotonis #{BaDou} Ba Dou are purgatives, drive out the old to bring in the new, reduce accumulation and harmonize the middle. Da Huang is cold and is used for Heat buildup in the Yang organs, has a low toxicity, breaks up Blood Stasis, clears Damp-Heat and relieves toxicity. Ba Dou is Hot, is used when Cold accumulates internally in the Yin organs and is very toxic.

Both Da Huang and Natrii Sulfas (Mirabilitum) #{MangXiao} Mang Xiao drain accumulated to treat clumped Heat in the Large Intestine leading to constipation. Da Huang is bitter and cold, drains Qi Level Heat in Yang Ming disorders, cools the Blood, resolves toxicity and breaks up static accumulations and is used to treat epistaxis, hemoptysis, red, swollen, painful eyes and gynecological abdominal masses. Mang Xiao clears the Large Intestine and softens hardness to treat constipation.
Steamed Rhubarb Shu Da Huang has moderated downward-draining and cooling properties and is more appropriate for weaker patients. Some sources say that it clears Damp-Heat.
Wine-washed Rhubarb Jiu Xi Da Huang cools upper Jiao Fire and directs it downward to treat Large Intestine Heat toxin with red eyes, toothache, mouth ulcers and restless Heat in the chest.
Vinegar Rhubarb Cu Da Huang enables the herb's action to enter the Liver, break up Blood Stasis and Drain Excess Heat form the Blood Level.
Charred Rhubarb Da Huang Tan reduces the herb's ability to drain downward and break up Blood Stasis, but enables it to stop bleeding to treat hemafecia due to Heat in the Intestines.
Slices of Pure Tranquility Qing Ning Pian is sold as a prepared medicine and is used for those who cannot tolerate a strong purgative.
Prepared Rhubarb Zhi Da Huang drains Damp-Heat and clears Heat through the stool.
This herb is uncommon in that it is used in three major medical traditions, Chinese, Ayurvedic and Greek/Western.
This herb may be used as a substitute for rhinoceros horn Xi Jiao and water buffalo horn Shui Niu Jiao.
